tool.name: Lattice

param.name: in_n
param.dialogReference:
The value of N is used to calculate the number of points and thereby the density of the lattice.

As an example, a value of N = 2500 generates a lattice spacing between points of approximately 300 Kilomteres.

param.name: in_sr
param.displayname: Geographic coordinate system of lattice points generated by tool
param.dialogReference: The required geographic coordinate system of the lattice points.

param.name: in_gdb
param.displayname: File Geodatabase for lattice points feature class created by tool
param.dialogReference: Select an existing File Geodatabase which will be used to store the lattice points feature class generated by the tool. If necessary create the File Geodatabase prior to running the tool.

param.name: out_fc
param.displayname: Name of lattice points feature class created by tool
param.dialogReference: Provide a name for the lattice point feature class to be stored in the File Geodatabase selected.

tool.summary: Creates a feature class of points which are equally spaced across the globe using a fibonaaci lattice approach, based on methodology by Gonzalez, A. (2010) ‘Measurement of Areas on a Sphere Using Fibonacci and Latitude–Longitude Lattices’ in Mathematical Geosciences, 42(1), pp.49-64; and Baselga, S. (2018) ‘Fibonacci lattices for the evaluation and optimization of map projections’ in Computers & Geosciences, 117(2018), pp.1-8.

searchKeys.keyword: fibonacci lattice point features equal space

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Creates a feature class of points which are equally spaced across the globe using a fibonaaci lattice approach, based on methodology by Gonzalez, A. (2010) ‘Measurement of Areas on a Sphere Using Fibonacci and Latitude–Longitude Lattices’ in Mathematical Geosciences, 42(1), pp.49-64; and Baselga, S. (2018) ‘Fibonacci lattices for the evaluation and optimization of map projections’ in Computers & Geosciences, 117(2018), pp.1-8.
